pasta.web.controller

Class AdminController

  • java.lang.Object
    • pasta.web.controller.AdminController

  • @Controller
@RequestMapping(value="admin/")
public class AdminController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller class for admin functions.

    Handles mappings of $PASTAUrl$/admin/...

    Both students and teaching staff can access this url. Students have highly limited functionality. If the authentication system is not using the database, then it's an empty page.

    Since:
    2014-01-23
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Alex Radu

      • getUser

        public PASTAUser getUser()
        Get the current logged in user.

        Gets the "user" attribute from the current session and gets the user with that username from the UserManager.

        Returns:
        the user or null if there is no user with that name.
        See Also:
        UserManager.getUser(String)

      • get

        @RequestMapping(value="",
                method=GET)
public java.lang.String get(org.springframework.ui.ModelMap model)
        $PASTAUrl$/admin/

        Ensure user exists and has authenticated against the system. If they have not, redirect them to the login screen.

        Attributes:

        authTypeProjectProperties.getInstance().getAuthenticationValidator().getClass().getName()
        unikeyPASTAUser currently logged in user
        peopleOnly if tutor or instructor! - the list of users (both students and teaching staff)
        addressesOnly if tutor or instructor! - the list of sever addresses for which to authenticate against
        JSP:
        • user/admin
        Parameters:
        model - the model
        Returns:
        the string identifier to the location of the view.

      • changePassword

        @RequestMapping(value="/changePassword/",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String changePassword(org.springframework.ui.ModelMap model,
                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                             @ModelAttribute(value="changePasswordForm")
                                             ChangePasswordForm form)
        $PASTAUrl$/admin/changePassword/

        Change the password of a user.

        Ensure user exists and has authenticated against the system. If they have not, redirect them to the referring url.

        Parameters:
        model - the model
        request - the http request object, used to send the user back to the page that referred them
        form - the change password form
        Returns:
        redirect to the referrer url

      • replaceStudents

        @RequestMapping(value="/replaceStudents/",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String replaceStudents(org.springframework.ui.ModelMap model,
                                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                              @RequestParam(value="list")
                                              java.lang.String list)
        $PASTAUrl$/admin/replaceStudents/ - POST

        Replace the list of students with a new one. Parse the csv format that is passed in (e.g. username,stream,class), turn into PASTAUser and then call UserManager.replaceStudents(List).

        Ensure user exists and has authenticated against the system. If they have not, redirect them to the referring url.

        REQUIRES: Tutor or higher permission

        Parameters:
        model - the model
        request - the http request object, used to send the user back to the page that referred them
        list - the list of students which will be used to replace (csv format).
        Returns:
        redirect to the referrer url

      • updateStudents

        @RequestMapping(value="/updateStudents/",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String updateStudents(org.springframework.ui.ModelMap model,
                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                             @RequestParam(value="list")
                                             java.lang.String list)
        $PASTAUrl$/admin/updateStudents/ - POST

        Update the list of students with a new one. Parse the csv format that is passed in (e.g. username,stream,class), turn into PASTAUser and then call UserManager.updateStudents(List).

        Ensure user exists and has authenticated against the system. If they have not, redirect them to the referring url.

        REQUIRES: Tutor or higher permission

        Parameters:
        model - the model
        request - the http request object, used to send the user back to the page that referred them
        list - the list of students which will be used to replace (csv format).
        Returns:

      • replaceTutors

        @RequestMapping(value="/replaceTutors/",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String replaceTutors(org.springframework.ui.ModelMap model,
                                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                            @RequestParam(value="list")
                                            java.lang.String list)
        $PASTAUrl$/admin/replaceTutors/ - POST

        Replace the list of teaching staff with a new one. Parse the csv format that is passed in (e.g. username,permissionlevel,class1,class2,...,classN), turn into PASTAUser and then call UserManager.replaceTutors(List).

        Ensure user exists and has authenticated against the system. If they have not, redirect them to the referring url.

        REQUIRES: Tutor or higher permission

        Parameters:
        model - the model
        request - the http request object, used to send the user back to the page that referred them
        list - the list of teaching staff which will be used to replace (csv format).
        Returns:
        redirect to the referrer url

      • updateTutors

        @RequestMapping(value="/updateTutors/",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String updateTutors(org.springframework.ui.ModelMap model,
                                           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                           @RequestParam(value="list")
                                           java.lang.String list)
        $PASTAUrl$/admin/updateTutors/ - POST

        Update the list of teaching staff with a new one. Parse the csv format that is passed in (e.g. username,permissionlevel,class1,class2,...,classN), turn into PASTAUser and then call UserManager.updateTutors(List).

        Ensure user exists and has authenticated against the system. If they have not, redirect them to the referring url.

        REQUIRES: Tutor or higher permission

        Parameters:
        model - the model
        request - the http request object, used to send the user back to the page that referred them
        list - the list of teaching staff which will be used to replace (csv format).
        Returns:
        redirect to the referrer url

        @RequestMapping(value="/delete/{username}/")
public java.lang.String deleteUser(org.springframework.ui.ModelMap model,
                                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                         @PathVariable(value="username")
                                         java.lang.String username)
        $PASTAUrl$/admin/delete/{username}/

        Delete a user from the system.

        Ensure user exists and has authenticated against the system. If they have not, redirect them to the referring url.

        REQUIRES: Tutor or higher permission

        Parameters:
        model - the model
        request - the http request object, used to send the user back to the page that referred them
        username - the name of the user
        Returns:

      • changeAuthType

        @RequestMapping(value="/auth/",
                method=GET)
public java.lang.String changeAuthType(org.springframework.ui.ModelMap model,
                                             javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                             @RequestParam(value="type")
                                             java.lang.String type,
                                             @RequestParam(value="address")
                                             java.lang.String[] address)
        $PASTAUrl$/admin/auth/

        Change the authentication system and/or addresses.

        Ensure user exists and has authenticated against the system. If they have not, redirect them to the referring url.

        REQUIRES: Tutor or higher permission

        Parameters:
        model - the model
        request - the http request object, used to send the user back to the page that referred them
        type - the authentication type
        address - the addresses which will be used by the authentication
        Returns:
        redirect to the referrer url
